intro: Dichapetalum flavovirens, commonly known as the yellow-green dichapetalum, is a flowering plant native to Africa. It belongs to the family Bignoniaceae and is characterized by its showy, yellow-green flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite and ovate, with a smooth surface and a slightly waxy texture. The flowers are clustered in racemes and are pollinated primarily by insects, contributing to its ecological significance in its native habitat.
